knowledge.question: On the second line of the above Python snippet, x is now 11.  What else is occuring?
choices: The original int object was changed from 10 to 11 because it's mutable.
A new int object is created because int objects are immutable
A new int object is created because int objects are static
The original int object was changed from 10 to 11 because it's dynamic.
explanation: Objects of built-in types like (int, float, bool, str, tuple, unicode) are immutable and Python int objects are not static unless they're declared as class variables.
